rename.from: runtime/lua/vim/_watch.lua:100: ENOENT: no such file or directory
rename.to: runtime/lua/vim/_watch.lua:99: ENOENT: no such file or directory

body: Sorry, we need complete reproducible steps we can test with `nvim --clean -u test.lua`.

issue.title: fix(lsp): disable didChangeWatchedFiles on Linux

repository.name: neovim
repository.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

issue.body:
Problem:

The file watcher backends for Linux have too many limitations and
doesn't work reliably.

Solution:

disable didChangeWatchedFiles on Linux

Ref: #27807, #28058, #23291, #26520

body:
> Also facing the same error when I open a file with gopls as the LSP.
> 
> ```
> LSP[gopls]: Error SERVER_REQUEST_HANDLER_ERROR: "...y/nvim-macos-arm64/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/_watch.lua:99: ENOENT: no such file or directory"
> ```
> 
> Only get this on the nightly branch:
> 
> ```
> NVIM v0.10.0-dev-2961+g4d52b0cf6
> Build type: RelWithDebInfo
> LuaJIT 2.1.1713484068
> ```
> 
> And not on the stable:
> 
> ```
> NVIM v0.9.5
> Build type: Release
> LuaJIT 2.1.1693350652
> 
>    system vimrc file: "$VIM/sysinit.vim"
>   fall-back for $VIM: "
> /nix/store/nbyjp8sj5w1jwdqsks5as1fp4vkm9lga-neovim-unwrapped-0.9.5/share/nvim
> "
> 
> Run :checkhealth for more info
> ```

@lewis6991 this issue is happening on macOS as well
Must be a different issue then.
